column1: # The 1921 total has been retained - the sheet shows the figure in brackets because of a 40 yards gauge move during the year.
# The 1939 total has been reduced by 0.01 compared to the sheet figure to match the sum of the months.
# The January 1940 figure is identified as part-estimate on the sheet and has been retained.
# The rain gauge was originally at Mount Villas - it moved to Chalfonts in October 1921.
# Mount Villas is on the corner of Tadcaster Road and Nelson's Lane.
# Chalfonts (now demolished) was three houses north of Mount Villas - elevation 50 ft.
# The original rain gauge was replaced by a new one in July 1930.
